title: Installation
description: A guide to install Pinexio locally to your system and get it running

body.raw:
# Installation Guide Welcome to the installation guide for forking the application from GitHub and setting up your development environment! Step 1: Fork the Repository
Visit our GitHub repository and click the "Fork" button to create your own copy.
Fork the Repository on GitHub
Step 2: Clone Your Fork
After forking, clone your repository to your local machine: ```sh git clone https://github.com/sanjayc208/pinexio.git ```
Step 3: Install Dependencies
Install the project dependencies using your preferred package manager:
Step 4: Run the Development Server
Start your development server with one of the following commands:
Step 5: Make Changes

If you want to make changes:

1. Edit files in the root directory / for global configurations. 2. Update or create MDX files in the docs directory to modify or add documentation. 3. Update or create MDX files in the docs directory to modify or add documentation.

page1.mdx

page2.mdx

 4. Refer to the existing documentation to see how things work.
## What is MDX? MDX is an extension of Markdown that allows you to write JSX (React components) inside your Markdown files. This means you can mix content with interactive components seamlessly. For example, in a normal Markdown file, you might write: ```md # Welcome to My Docs This is a simple Markdown page. ``` But in MDX, you can add React components directly: ```mdx import { Button } from '@/components/ui/button'; # Welcome to My Docs This is a simple Markdown page with a button: ``` ## Creating an MDX File To add a new documentation page, create a new `.mdx` file inside the `docs` directory: ```sh echo "# My New Page" > docs/my-new-page.mdx ``` This file will automatically be picked up by the system and rendered as a new documentation page. Your folder structure should look like this:

my-new-page.mdx

another-page.mdx

 ðŸŽ‰ Thatâ€™s it! You now have a functional documentation site up and running with your first MDX page.
